title: We Got Vaxxed: The Pickup Basketball Game Is Back
sub_head: They stopped playing during the pandemic. Then came the vaccines. Playing again feels normal—and painful.
body:
One of the first things that Adam Roussas wanted to do when enough of his friends had been fully vaccinated was one of the many things he had desperately missed during the pandemic. He texted his pickup basketball group chat: Did anyone else want to play again?
“My lungs may not be ready,” wrote Roussas, a medical student, “but my figurative heart is.”
Before the pandemic, Roussas had a standing Thursday morning pickup game with a bunch of guys in their 20s and 30s in Tucson, Ariz., where they knew each other through college, church and their local coffee shop. It had been more than a year since they last played. But now it was time. They were so eager to get back on the court that when they realized their regular gym was still closed, they scouted the area to find an outdoor hoop where they could play as soon as possible.
“As soon as everyone got finished getting vaccinated, we were out there almost immediately,” said Ryan Reid, a college student.
So how was it?
